title: School Colors Episode 5: "The Melting Pot"
description: Until recently, School District 28 in Queens, N.Y., was characterized by a white Northside, and a Black Southside. But today, the district, and Queens at large, has become what is considered to be one of the most diverse places on the planet. So how did District 28 go from being defined by this racial binary, to a place where people brag about how diverse it is?

itunes:title: School Colors Episode 5: "The Melting Pot"
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Once known for its Black/white racial binary, Queens, N.Y., has become one of the most diverse places in the world. How has immigration to the community affected its racial map?
